title: What is the name of the Panthers’ drumline?
explanation: The drumline is called PurrCussion.

title: Which running back achieved 1,000 rushing and 1,000 receiving yards in one season for the Panthers?
explanation: Christian McCaffrey accomplished this in 2019.

title: The Panthers represent which two U.S. states?
explanation: They are the team for both Carolinas.

title: Who coached the Panthers to their first playoff appearance?
explanation: Dom Capers coached their first playoff team in 1996.

title: What is unique about the primary design of the Panthers' logo?
options: It mimics the outline of the Carolinas
It's based on a real panther photo
explanation: The design mimics North and South Carolina.

title: Which former Panther became a TV game analyst for their preseason broadcasts as of 2021?
explanation: Steve Smith is a preseason analyst.

title: How many seasons did John Fox coach the Panthers?
explanation: John Fox coached for 9 full seasons (2002–2010), often rounded to ten due to overlap.

title: What is the name of the Carolina Panthers' cheerleading team?
explanation: Their cheerleading squad is the TopCats.

title: Who did the Panthers defeat for their first ever playoff win?
explanation: Their first playoff win was over the Cowboys in the divisional round.

title: Which team defeated the Panthers in the 2015 Super Bowl (Super Bowl 50)?
explanation: The Denver Broncos beat Carolina in Super Bowl 50.

title: In their inaugural season, how many regular season games did the Panthers win?
explanation: They went 7–9 in their first season.

title: Which year did the Panthers set an all-time best record for an NFL expansion team in its first season?
explanation: They had the best inaugural record in 1995.

title: Who did the Panthers select with the second overall pick in the 2002 NFL draft?
explanation: Julius Peppers was the 2nd pick in 2002.

title: What team did the Panthers defeat for their only playoff shutout on the road since 1980?
explanation: They blanked the Giants 23-0 in the 2005 playoffs.

title: What phrase is featured on the Panthers’ post-2012 Nike jersey collar?
explanation: The collar says "Keep Pounding" in honor of Sam Mills.

title: What is the maximum number of times in a season the Panthers may wear their blue alternate jersey, according to NFL rules?
explanation: NFL allows blue jerseys up to twice per season.

title: What was the Panthers’ regular season record in their 2015 Super Bowl run?
explanation: They went an NFC-tied record 15–1.

title: Which defensive end was inducted into the Hall of Fame and played for the Panthers twice (2002–2009, 2017–2018)?
explanation: Julius Peppers played two stints with the team.

title: Which coach led Carolina to three postseason appearances and a Super Bowl?
explanation: John Fox led them to one Super Bowl and three playoffs.

title: Who was the Panthers’ starting quarterback for most of the 2003 season?
explanation: Jake Delhomme was QB in 2003.

title: Which multi-time Carolina Panthers cheerleader squad made NFL history in 2022 for including Justine Lindsay?
explanation: The TopCats added Justine Lindsay.

title: Who was interim coach after Ron Rivera’s firing in 2019?
explanation: Perry Fewell was the interim.

title: What station is the current flagship for Panthers radio broadcasts?
explanation: WRFX is the flagship.

title: Who was the founding head coach of the Cincinnati Bengals?
explanation: Paul Brown was the team's founder and first head coach.

title: What stadium did the Bengals call home before moving to Paycor Stadium?
explanation: Riverfront Stadium served as the Bengals' main home before Paycor Stadium.

title: Who inherited controlling interest in the Bengals after Paul Brown's death?
explanation: Mike Brown, Paul Brown's son, inherited controlling interest in the Bengals.

title: Which Bengal coached the team to both its 1980s Super Bowl appearances?
explanation: Forrest Gregg coached the Bengals to Super Bowls XVI and XXIII.

title: What AFC North rival shares both similar colors and origins with the Bengals?
explanation: The Browns and Bengals share origins through Paul Brown and similar colors.

title: Who won NFL MVP as a Bengals quarterback in 1981?
explanation: Ken Anderson was NFL MVP in 1981.

title: Which franchise did the Bengals beat to advance to Super Bowl LVI?
explanation: The Bengals defeated the Chiefs to reach Super Bowl LVI.

title: Over which team did the Bengals win their first-ever playoff game in 31 years during the 2021 season?
explanation: They beat the Las Vegas Raiders in the Wild Card round.

title: Who was the Bengals' 'de facto general manager,' making personnel decisions in recent years?
explanation: Duke Tobin acts as the team's unofficial GM.

title: Which city was never seriously considered for the Bengals' franchise location?
explanation: The main cities considered were Cincinnati and Columbus.

title: Which Bengals head coach led the team to five straight playoff appearances (2011–2015)?
explanation: Marvin Lewis led the Bengals during that playoff streak.

title: Who was the first Bengals quarterback to successfully run Bill Walsh’s West Coast offense?
explanation: Virgil Carter implemented Walsh's passing offense first.

title: What is the name of the Bengals' tiger mascot?
explanation: Who Dey is the Bengals' official mascot.

title: Against which team did the Bengals lose both Super Bowls in the 1980s?
explanation: They lost both to the San Francisco 49ers.

title: Which quarterback did the Bengals draft first overall in 2020?
explanation: Joe Burrow was the 2020 first overall pick.

title: In what year did the Bengals debut their striped tiger helmet design?
explanation: The tiger-striped helmet debuted in 1981.

title: Which city was NOT mentioned as within 110 miles of the Bengals' home base?
explanation: Toledo is not among the listed cities.

title: What was the original logo on the Bengals' helmets?
explanation: They featured 'Bengals' in black letters.

title: What year did the Bengals play their first season in the NFL?
explanation: The Bengals became part of the NFL after the 1970 merger.

title: Which Bengals wide receiver was known for colorful touchdown celebrations from 2001–2010?
explanation: Chad Johnson, later Ochocinco, was famous for his celebrations.

title: Which team did the Bengals defeat for their first division sweep in 2009?
explanation: They swept the entire AFC North in 2009.

title: Who owns the majority share of the Bengals as of 2023?
explanation: Mike Brown is the majority owner.

title: Which important offensive system was popularized by former Bengals assistant Bill Walsh?
explanation: Bill Walsh developed the West Coast offense in Cincinnati.

title: Who led the NFL in passing yards for the Bengals in 2024?
explanation: Joe Burrow led the league in passing yards.

title: Which Bengal set a franchise record for completion percentage in a season?
explanation: Ken Anderson holds the season completion percentage record.

title: Who became head coach of the Bengals in 2019?
explanation: Zac Taylor was hired in 2019.

title: Which Bengals rivalry is known as the 'Battle of Ohio'?
explanation: The Bengals vs. Browns is called the Battle of Ohio.

title: Who was named NFL Coach of the Year for the Bengals 2009 season?
explanation: Marvin Lewis was awarded in 2009.

title: Which defensive scheme was invented by Bengals coordinator Dick LeBeau to counter the West Coast offense?
explanation: Dick LeBeau created the zone blitz.

title: What playoff round did the 2015 Bengals lose in, setting an NFL record for opening-round losses?
explanation: The Bengals lost five straight Wild Card games.

title: What year did the Bengals move into what is now called Paycor Stadium?
explanation: The Bengals moved into the stadium in 2000.

title: Who replaced Andy Dalton as QB when he was injured in the 2015 season?
explanation: A.J. McCarron started after Dalton's injury.

title: Who led the league in sacks for the Bengals in 2024?
explanation: Trey Hendrickson led the league.

title: Who is the Bengals' official cheerleading squad?
explanation: The Ben-Gals are the team's cheerleaders.

title: Which league did the original Cincinnati Bengals teams play in before World War II?
explanation: They played in earlier versions of the American Football League.

title: Which color was ADDED as the secondary color to the Bengals' uniforms in their first season?
explanation: Black was added as the secondary color.

title: Who holds the Bengals record for most sacks in a single season as of 2024?
explanation: Trey Hendrickson has the single-season sack record.

title: Which franchise shares its city and former stadium with the Bengals?
explanation: The Cincinnati Reds shared Riverfront Stadium with the Bengals.

title: Who was the first Bengals player to win the AFL Rookie of the Year award?
explanation: Paul Robinson won AFL Rookie of the Year in 1968.
